attributes.action: Unnecessary body exposure in the media.
attributes.additional_details:
Responsible department: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

In pretty much all advertisement and media, half naked people (especially women) are used to make a product more appealing.

People within this forever sex-obsessed society think this is harmless, but this raises issues:
1. It makes women seem inferior. (As you see with jobs, capability, and clothing expectations)
2. It has created many sex-obsessed generations. (Shallow minded, selfishness from urge)
3. I have also witnessed that it has helped create many pedophiles.
4. It drastically raises anorexia.

I would like the government to make everybody in advertisements to be fully dressed and wearing appropriate clothing. (Covering stomach, thighs, back, and chest.) I would also like for all forms of under wear to advertised only on manikins.
